main event: A military vessel spotted a high-speed, yellow-orange flaming object traveling in a southerly direction, which seemed to be breaking up.
interesting points: The object was sighted by three crew members of the ship.
The object was traveling at a high speed in a southerly direction.
The object appeared to be breaking up as it was observed.
The sighting occurred at the coordinates 24-14N, 83-32W in the Atlantic Ocean.
The object was definitely identified as satellite debris from the Cosmos 213 launch.
witnesses: three crew members of the ship
